mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Monroe, James, 1799-1870
mdRecord.dcterms:description: His Regiment will leave Florida soon, and be stationed in Trention, New Jersey; information concerning killings, despite the treaty; mentions the Seminoles, McRinRics ?, and Hostida bruka; other information concerning the war, such as withdrawal of troops and the capture of tribes. Autographed Letter Signed
mdRecord.dcterms:title: J. Monroe, Jr., Fort Atkinson, Tallahassee, Florida, to his aunt, Eliza M. (Douglas) Monroe, New York., 4 June 1839.
